author: wired blogs
text: date: fri, 8 oct 1999 12:51:53 -0700 (pdt) from: will crowe (wcrowe1@yahoo.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: microsoft lambasts linuxregarding your article on microsoft and linux ("microsoft lambasts linux," 8.oct.99). even if what microsoft says is true, their argumentsare pretty laughable. here's why: a networkadministrator or mis manager can install linux on anold computer destined for the trash heap, and try theoperating system for almost no cost. if some benefitis drawn from the experiment, great. if not, itdoesn't affect the bottom line, has no impact on thebudget, and the bosses don't even have to know aboutit. linus torvalds was recently asked what he woulddo if microsoft beat out linux in the marketplace.linus shrugged his shoulders and said, "i'll just keepworking on it." microsoft is going to wear themselvesout shadow boxing.
